title.narrative: Shelter reconstruction and repair in selected IDP camps of Kachin and Shan States

description.narrative:
The on-going Kachin conflict that restarted in 2011 has resulted in large scale displacement of people. Most of the internally displaced persons (IDPs) have sought shelter in camps and camp-like settings across the area. As a first line of response providers, many of the Religious facilities such as Churches and Monasteries were used to provide temporary shelters for the IDPs.
Since many shelters built in 2011/2012 have already reached the end of their lifespan or did not meet the minimum standards in terms of size, structural safety and durability, a priority activity in 2017 remain the perpetual cycle of replacing sub-standard/ no longer habitable temporary shelters to ensure that minimum standards are met and protection risks associated with overcrowding and lack of privacy such as a gender-based violence are mitigated.
The proposed project focusing on the shelter component of MHF is seeking support to improve the shelter conditions of IDPs in selected camps in Bhamo in Kachin and Lashio in Shan states. The diversity of shelter situation would require different type of shelter support in these two areas of KMSS operations. Support will be provided for reconstruction and repairing the existing shelters as the conditions is such that the shelter life can be extended by appropriate repairs. The proposed plan of shelter will not directly address to specific needs on women’s participation, gender equal-society, women’s humanitarian needs but it will contributes towards more gender participation, decision in shelter design in term of privacy for young girls and boys with the parents in the camps.
Overall KMSS plans to construct and repair at least 148 units of shelter to support for 148 IDP households will be benefited from this shelter assistance. 103 women headed households out of 148 household are benefited including 17 disable households, 28 the most vulnerable households. The direct beneficiaries will be about 606 (117 Men, 168 Women, 153 Boys, 168 Girls) from the construction and repair of 148 units in 4 targeted camps.
The shelter design is adapted from the shelter cluster in Kachin and Shan. According to the community discussion, the IDP requests new constructed shelter will be stronger than existing jungle wood and bamboo structure. After conducting market prices assessment, both local materials (wood and bamboo) cost are significantly high. So, the IDPs and KMSS decided to use steel structure to be more strengthened and longer life. On the other hand, these structural and material can be used if the relocation or returned is possible in the future. All these shelter materials have to be procured from China, and China often controlled all exports so the price are much getting higher. We can only access to China market.
